name: BlazeRush
description: BlazeRush is a dynamic arcade racing survival game with no health, no levelling and no brakes! You can assemble a team of friends to play in local or online multiplayer, choose a car to your taste and chase, blow up and cut off! Adapt your style and tactics to new enemies, obstacles and tracks.

reviews.review_text: Bought this game with the intent of playing it on the rift CV1, apparently it just doesn't work at all. I think the version of the game that supports CV1 is only avaiable through oculus home which sucks.

Bought it for Oculus CV1. Absurdly, the option to play it with oculus is not supported in the Steam version. I would say: 'Please add this option', but I assume there is a contract which will not allow this game to be Oculus compatible if not bought in Oculus store.

This is a hidden gem.  A fantastic arcade top-down action racer with great music, great visuals and tons of variety to keep you entertained for hours.   I'd also assume this would be great to play with friends.  ♥

This is the most insanely, incredibly, awesomely arcade racing game of all history. It's not only a game inspired by Rock and Roll Racing but rather an entire redesign/redefinition/reimagination of the whole genre. If you like racing games and never played R'n'RR worry no more: this game is a living legacy of his predescessor; if you did, don't even continue reading my review, stop it right now and go get it!!!

Well, the name doesnt dissapoint. This is an amazing couch party game to play with your friends or people you dont like ;) It reminds me of a cyborg version of Mashed, one of the greats when it comes to arcade death race.  > Controls are easy ; anyone can play > Variety of weapons > Clean, smooth visuals (can also run on a potato) > Tons of different tracks > Unique modes (my favourite is Rocket Party on Death Race) > Great pick up & play  > Upto 4 local players > Bots have a difficulty option and are fun to play with  > Co-op Campaign   - A save replay feature would be a great addiciotn to the game  < Horrid Menu (difficult to setup game preferences) < Playing alone gets dull < Soundtrack is abit basic

One of the best Oculus Rift supported games so far. Great performance on a 780 in rift mode. Feels really comfortable to play for ages, which is rare in VR for me.   Game is loads of fun in VR, especially if you play online.   A must have if you own an Oculus Rift.
Very funny game to play with your friend's.

BlazeRush is a fun racing battle game. It's a party game so if you have friends who will buy the game with you, it's much better. Can easily be played with keyboard but the experience is better if you have the 360 control while you sit back, relax and have some fun.
awesome fun, even in single player mode, Linux support is flawless, really good game.

This is a great little game. It's reminiscent of the old game Rock n' Roll Racing for Super Nintendo. The controls take some adjusting to because it is a top down view, instead of third person, which requires you to use all 360 degrees of the joystick. Very fun, replayability is high. I love finding great games that don't cost very much!!!

Superb local multiplayer racing action here. All the cars feel unique and the items make for intense gameplay. The king of the hill and death race modes are my favorites. The skill ceiling is low so it's very easy to jump in and succeed. The only downfall is the lack of maps. You'll probably run through all of them within an hour, but it's not that big of a deal. The real joy of the gameplay will come from those you're playing with.
It's one of the must haves couch party games when you have friends over! Really fun to play the local multiplayer. :)
Hands down one of the most beautiful and fun games for the rift, highly reccomended
Amazing Oculus Rift support, proof that the Rift is more than FPS games. Played for an hour straight with no sim sickness or ill-effects.

Car controls are relative to screenspace, not relative to the car. If you have any played any racing game before or driven an actual car, you'll be familiar with the concept that steering to the left will make the car turn left. Not in this game. A really bad design decision and no option for traditional steering.
This game has excellent VR support! (DK2)
Purchased to play online with friends, but there were zero hosted games and no players joining. Fun game but the community is a ghost town.

If you've got the people this is an amazing multiplayer experience. BlazeRush is a top-down racer with a few different game modes and plenty of pickups to fire at your opponents. There's a singleplayer campaign as well but you'll be finding most of your fun with the multiplayer options. All the racers share the same screen so you get pulled ahead (or destroyed) for falling behind. There's a standard lap race mode, a mode where the person in first the longest wins, and Death Race. The last mode is by far most fun I've had with this game. A giant machine chases all the racers around the track until everyone is eliminated. The person that survives longest nets the most points, and it starts right back up again until you reach a set number. This leads to plenty of hilarious moments as players struggle to stay far ahead with boosters or sabotage the competition with firepower. I'd say it's a definite buy. Online multiplayer's dead though so grab this with 2 or 3 friends.

Fast and genial! I start to test the game for an upcoming LAN but ended finishing the game. This game is brilliant, beautiful, optimized, small spaces and really really fun. Anyone can play and enjoy! It's diversified, challenging and crazy. It deserves much more credit.  For info, it support multiplayers up to 4 locally with 4 controllers
Pathetic, the camera is not in the correct place for racing!
This game just gets more fun as you unlock new weapons and boosters. Must have if you own an Oculus Rift, no motion sickness, just pure awesome.
Not a good game!
After about ten minutes I was wishing I was playing GRID 2 instead.
Works super well with VR, its pretty cool, wish there was more complex track designs though,

This is now my favorite game for the Oculus Rift. The 3D effect is AMAZING in this game! Can't wait for more from these developers! On a side note, the only gripe I have is that you must accelerate with the left thumb stick if using the 360 controller. This leads to fatigue after playing for a while. !!!Developers listen up!!! Can you PLEASE change the right trigger to accelerate, left stick to steer and X/A for power-ups?!?! I think this would be the best layout, less fatigue. Thanks and I hope this review gets to the consumer and the developers :D

I've only played against AI so far, but this game is fantastic! If you're on the fence, grab a Rock n' Roll Racing ROM and imagine it modernized with a decent frame rate.  Only complaint is that the default camera view — zoom to fit all 4 cars on screen — is terrible. Change it to center on your car and you'll be much happier.
Smooth VR Experience (DK2).
Damn good fun racing game. Co-op is great, graphics & FX are great, sound is great, control is great, pace is great. Really just a great game.

This game is great fun - reminds me of the awesome times I used to have playing Micro Machines on the Playstation many moons ago. The only flaw in the game is that the camera doesn't always keep you within its viewport which can win or lose you a race.
Very good VR integration and it plays like SNES Rock'n Roll Racing in 3D with techno music =)
Grab some friends and start a death race. Let chaos and hilarity ensue!

Very fun. Cool graphics. Works well and looks nice in 4k. Works with Linux. Quite a lot of worlds with different challenges. Controller highly recommended.  If you have stuttering with Linux in a map or at first, try letting it run a bit then see if the stuttering disappears. For me it seems the game is simply not preloading some resources in Linux, probably the graphical effects. Might also be related to using the radeon open source driver or glamor.
Laid back local multiplayer game that is really easy to get in to, even with your non-gamer friends.

One of the (if not THE) most fun games i played with friends. The best way to do it: 4 friends in the same PC, 3 good controllers and 1 cheap controller (the cheaper and basic, the better). The 4th place gets the stinky controller for the next race. Profit (?

This game is a real hidden gem.   Pros The graphics and physics are great. You Live and Die by the Blue pick ups. The 360 no-scope backwards shot feels so good. 3 Types of cars (hover, wheels, treads) all handle differntly and take time to master 3 Types of Game Modes Variety of Tracks Local + Online Play up to 8 players Those sweet steam cards Controller support  Cons AI will gang bang you like a pleb   but you can still win  its really fun.
Fantastic game, AMAZING with the Oculus Rift, TONS OF FUN!

Fantastic game. Very accessible, low learning curve, decent skill cap. Tons of different modes and vehicles, lots of replay value. Easy to pick up and put down for a few minutes at a time. Local multiplayer is a blast. Graphics and artstyle are great, yet it runs perfectly at 1920x1080 on my relatively underpowered laptop. Inexpensive on its own and even cheaper in a bundle. Looking forward to playing it more in the future. 10/10
Great! :D
Fun mario kart / offroad type game. :D  Definitely worth a look.

My favorite local coop game on Steam by a wide margin. Plug my HDMI in to put it on my TV, get a couple controllers, and this game is enthralling. It's also pretty forgiving in the standard race game mode; if you're off screen for any reason, you get teleported back on with a little leeway. That said, that handicap isn't enough to keep someone who's simply much better from kicking your butt every race, which is what you would hope happens in a racing game.  My listed playtime also doesn't reflect the most substantial part of my gameplay, which was when the internet died.

I got this game last night because it looked amazing in the pics and videos. It's visually just gorgeous! It's honestly probably THE best looking game I've ever played, and I've played many. It's a lot of fun racing and challenging as well. I keep saying 'just one more race' and want to keep on playing and playing. I hope the developers make more like it. Great job!
This game is very fun It has awesome gamemodes and a veriety of cars and gamemodes   There are 2 downsides  the lack of players & the camera
Mostly fun, but can be really annyoing at times. It is highly recommended to be played with other players, if you can find any that is of course...

At first I was annoyed at the camera angle while wearing the Rift. Everything was in my face, I was too close to the track. Then I stood up and the view was perfect.  A great game for the Rift. Highly recommended.  2016 EDIT: Now I have a Vive and there is zero support. Not sure if this is yet another Oculus exclusive, but my investment (and interest) in this game has now fallen flat.
Awesome! This game is simple and fun. Like many games should be. You can control your car with the keyboard or better with the xbox controller. Too bad you can't control it with the mouse.

A great racing game in the style of RC Pro AM and Rock and Roll racing for 8 and 16 bit systems. The VR version is also fun, and addresses the main drawback of the game (being the occasionally frustrating camera views). You can enjoy the game either in or outside of VR.

I am a Linux gamer. I play mostly casual games. This game is some serious fun. It does require some getting used to the view and the carachteristics of the verhicles. This game is by far the most performant game I play under Linux. My complements to the developers of this game.
